title: Port forwarding?
body:
can I use something like UPNP portmapper to forward LOL to different ports if I don't have access to the admin controls of the wifi?

I'm in college, and want to play during my 3 hour class gaps
the program in question is this:
https://upnp-portmapper.sourceforge.io/

replies.body:
You *could* try that, but ultimately it may not work if your Campus IT people have those ports completely closed off. I haven't tried doing this myself, and I'm a little unsure of exactly how it works, so please be very careful using this as we may not be able to help!

What I *can* say for sure, is that if you take this port data to your Campus IT guys, they should be able to compare settings with this to make sure everything is setup in the best way for their students to have access to our servers.

> _**Here's a list of the ports you'll need forwarded to connect with our servers:**_

> 5000 - 5500 UDP (League of Legends Game Client)
> 
> 8393 - 8400 TCP (Patcher and Maestro)
> 
> 2099 TCP (PVP.Net)
> 
> 5223 TCP (PVP.Net)
> 
> 5222 TCP (PVP.Net)
> 
> 80 TCP (HTTP Connections)
> 
> 443 TCP (HTTPS Connections)
> 
> 8088 UDP and TCP (Spectator Mode)

thanks, ill try and let you know what happens though!

oh and lucky for me, I know the patcher isn't blocked, I just cant log in.

ive also observed that if I put in a wrong password, it tells me its incorrect, but if I put in the correct one, it hangs, so I feel like maybe pvp.net is whats blocked
